Metadata: "Journal of Waterway, Port, Coastal and Ocean Engineering," 111(5):895-909, September 1985.

An analytical model is developed to examine the response and efficiency of a rigid, hinged floating breakwater. The theoretical model, verified experimentally, is used to develop design curves which may be employed to estimate necessary physical breakwater characteristics to satisfy specified wave attenuation criteria. It is shown that a structure of reasonable size is an effective dynamic barrier for high-frequency waves and an effective kinematic barrier for low-frequency waves.
